result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael E Debarge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Bail applied to cost/surcharge.  Paid in full.  Balance of bail to be applied to 15TR4142.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Disclose to any physician in writing your drug history/dependency signed by your physician and provide a copy to your Agent.  Sign releases for Agent.

Driving will be as deemed appropriate by Agent once license is restored.
  Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Huber with non-working hours with standard release conditions - To commence 6:00 p.m. today 1/22/2016

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
